Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the concept of a "smart" passport by suggesting that it will be an "All-In-One Identity solution" for every Indian citizen, without providing sufficient evidence or support for such a claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to validate the existence of a new "smart" passport in India. The only information provided is a viral message on social media platforms, which may not be reliable.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the concept design created by Siddhant Gupta for a passport card is an indication of a soon-to-be-launched smart passport in India. However, this assumption may be problematic as there is no concrete evidence or official announcement supporting it.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation for the claim could be that the concept design created by Siddhant Gupta is being misinterpreted or misrepresented as a soon-to-be-launched smart passport in India. This alternative explanation suggests that the claim may not accurately represent the reality of the situation.
